segment.source: Checklist Configuring Rules for the Isolated Domain (Windows 10)
segment.target: Checklist Configuring Rules for the Isolated Domain (Windows 10)

segment.source: Checklist Configuring Rules for the Isolated Domain
segment.target: Checklist Configuring Rules for the Isolated Domain

segment.source: Checklist: Configuring Rules for the Isolated Domain
segment.target: Checklist: Configuring Rules for the Isolated Domain

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: The following checklists include tasks for configuring connection security rules and IPsec settings in your GPOs to implement the main zone in the isolated domain.
segment.target: The following checklists include tasks for configuring connection security rules and IPsec settings in your GPOs to implement the main zone in the isolated domain.

segment.source: Checklist: Configuring isolated domain rules
segment.target: Checklist: Configuring isolated domain rules

segment.source: Task
segment.target: Task

segment.source: Reference
segment.target: Reference

segment.source: Create a GPO for the computers in the isolated domain running one of the operating systems.
segment.target: Create a GPO for the computers in the isolated domain running one of the operating systems.

segment.source: After you have finished the tasks in this checklist and configured the GPO for that version of Windows, you can create a copy of it.
segment.target: After you have finished the tasks in this checklist and configured the GPO for that version of Windows, you can create a copy of it.

segment.source: Checklist: Creating Group Policy Objects
segment.target: Checklist: Creating Group Policy Objects

segment.source: Copy a GPO to Create a New GPO
segment.target: Copy a GPO to Create a New GPO

segment.source: If you are working on a GPO that was copied from another GPO, modify the group memberships and WMI filters so that they are correct for the isolated domain zone and the version of Windows for which this GPO is intended.
segment.target: If you are working on a GPO that was copied from another GPO, modify the group memberships and WMI filters so that they are correct for the isolated domain zone and the version of Windows for which this GPO is intended.

segment.source: Modify GPO Filters to Apply to a Different Zone or Version of Windows
segment.target: Modify GPO Filters to Apply to a Different Zone or Version of Windows

segment.source: Configure IPsec to exempt all ICMP network traffic from IPsec protection.
segment.target: Configure IPsec to exempt all ICMP network traffic from IPsec protection.

segment.source: Exempt ICMP from Authentication
segment.target: Exempt ICMP from Authentication

segment.source: Create a rule that exempts all network traffic to and from computers on the exemption list from IPsec.
segment.target: Create a rule that exempts all network traffic to and from computers on the exemption list from IPsec.

segment.source: Create an Authentication Exemption List Rule
segment.target: Create an Authentication Exemption List Rule

segment.source: Configure the key exchange (main mode) security methods and algorithms to be used.
segment.target: Configure the key exchange (main mode) security methods and algorithms to be used.

segment.source: Configure Key Exchange (Main Mode) Settings
segment.target: Configure Key Exchange (Main Mode) Settings

segment.source: Configure the data protection (quick mode) algorithm combinations to be used.
segment.target: Configure the data protection (quick mode) algorithm combinations to be used.

segment.source: Configure Data Protection (Quick Mode) Settings
segment.target: Configure Data Protection (Quick Mode) Settings

segment.source: Configure the authentication methods to be used.
segment.target: Configure the authentication methods to be used.

segment.source: Configure Authentication Methods
segment.target: Configure Authentication Methods

segment.source: Create the rule that requests authentication for all inbound network traffic.
segment.target: Create the rule that requests authentication for all inbound network traffic.

segment.source: Create an Authentication Request Rule
segment.target: Create an Authentication Request Rule

segment.source: Link the GPO to the domain level of the AD DS organizational unit hierarchy.
segment.target: Link the GPO to the domain level of the AD DS organizational unit hierarchy.

segment.source: Link the GPO to the Domain
segment.target: Link the GPO to the Domain

segment.source: Add your test computers to the membership group for the isolated domain.
segment.target: Add your test computers to the membership group for the isolated domain.

segment.source: Be sure to add at least one for each operating system supported by a different GPO in the group.
segment.target: Be sure to add at least one for each operating system supported by a different GPO in the group.

segment.source: Add Test Devices to the Membership Group for a Zone
segment.target: Add Test Devices to the Membership Group for a Zone

segment.source: Verify that the connection security rules are protecting network traffic to and from the test computers.
segment.target: Verify that the connection security rules are protecting network traffic to and from the test computers.

segment.source: Verify That Network Traffic Is Authenticated
segment.target: Verify That Network Traffic Is Authenticated

segment.source: Do not change the rules for any of your zones to require authentication until all of the zones have been set up and are operating correctly.
segment.target: Do not change the rules for any of your zones to require authentication until all of the zones have been set up and are operating correctly.
